summary: ABS BRAKE ACTUATOR MOTOR FAILURE. FOR THE THIRD TIME THE ABS MOTOR HAS FAILED.  CHRYSLER CLAIMS THE PART IS NO LONGER SERVICED AND WILL NOT HONOR THE LIFETIME WARRANTEE 96V099000.  THE PART IS AVAILABLE IN THE AFTERMARKET FOR ABOUT $350.00 AFTER A NUMBER OF CALLS TO FIAT CHRYSLER THEY WOULD ONLY OFFER TO BUY THE VEHICLE FROM ME FOR $300.00 WHICH IS THE LOWEST VALUE TO BE HAD BY KBB.

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1992 DODGE GRAND CHEROKEE. THE DEALER STATED THAT THEY HAVE BEEN MAKING THE REPAIRS PER RECALL 96V099000 SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC: ANTILOCK SINCE SEPTEMBER 25, 2009. SHE WILL CONTACT THE MANUFACTURER. THE VIN WAS NOT AVAILABLE. THE FAILURE AND THE CURRENT MILEAGES WERE 172,104.

I HAVE A 1992 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN MINI VAN. FRONT WHEEL DRIVE WITH A 3.3 ENGINE. EVERY TIME THE SERPENTINE BELT GETS THE SLIGHTEST AMOUNT OF MOISTURE ON IT...IT COMES OFF! AT LEAST ONCE A MONTH WHICH REQUIRES PAYING A PRO TO REINSTALL IT. THE BIGGEST PROBLEM IS THAT ONE LOSES ALL POWER STEERING NOT MENTION ALL FUNCTIONS CONTROLLED BY THE BELT! THE LAST TIME THIS HAPPENED TO ME WAS IN RAIN ON A BUSY TWO LANE HIGHWAY AND I ALMOST FLIPPED THE VAN! IT HAPPENS WITHOUT WARNING AND WITH IMMEDIATE  LOSS OF POWER STEERING. I HAVE RELOCATED THE TENSIONER AND PULLEY ASSEMBLY WITH NO SATISFACTION. THE PROBLEM IS THAT CHRYSLER DESIGNED THESE MINI VANS WITH NO SHIELDS INSTALLED TO TURN MOISTURE FROM THE ENTIRE PULLEY SYSTEM (TOP OR BOTTOM) AND THE PULLEYS HAVE NO 'LIP' TO HOLD THE BELT IN PLACE ALLOWING IT TO SLIDE OFF WHEN WET! IS THERE NO WAY CHRYSLER CAN BE FORCED TO INSTALL AN OEM PRODUCT OR SHIELD TO PREVENT THIS AND SAVE LIVES? THIS IS A VERY COMMON PROBLEM IN ALL CHRYSLER MINI VANS FROM APPRX. 1992-2007. *TR

OUR VAN STARTED SHOWING HOLES IN THE PAINT IN 1993 (VERY SMALL ON THE HOOD).  WE TRIED TO FIX THE PROBLEMS WITH THE TOUCH UP PAINT PROVIDED.  THIS DID NOT WORK.  THE PAINT STARTED BUBBLING UP AND "POPPING".  EACH TIME IT DID THAT A HOLE WOULD APPEAR THAT GOT BIGGER AND BIGGER.  WE LATER NOTICED THE ROOF DOING THE SAME THING.  EVERY TIME WE WASHED THE VEHICLE (GENTLY) MORE PAINT CAME OFF.  EVERY TIME WE BROUGHT THE CAR IN FOR SERVICING (AT DEALERS IN RICHARDSON, TX AND PLANO TX DEALERS WE MENTIONED TO THE SERVICE MANAGERS THE PROBLEM AND ASKED IF ANY OTHER VEHICLES WERE HAVING THE SAME PAINT PROBLEMS THEY INDICATED THEY HAD NEVER HEARD NOR SEEN ANY OFHER VEHICLES WITH THE SAME PROBLEMS.  THEY ALWAYS INDICATED IT WAS OUR PROBLEM.  WE ASKED HOW MUCH IT WOULD COST TO RE-PAINT THE VAN AND WERE TOLD THAT IT WOULD COST $2,000 OR SO DOLLARS.  THEY ALWAYS INDICATED THAT IT WAS OUR PROBLEM AND NO ONE ELSE HAD HAD THE PROBLEM.  I HAVE COME TO FIND OUT THAT THIS IS A COMMON PROBLEM WITH VEHICLES BETWEEN 89-94 AND THAT THE PAINT/PRIMER BOND WAS THE PROBLEM NOT POTENTIAL CUSTOMER NEGLECT.  OUR VAN STATRED RUSTING SO WE WENT TO SEVERAL PAINT PLACES TO GET ESTIMATES FOR RE-PAINTING.  WE ARE NOW HAVING THE VAN RE-PAINTED FOR APPROX. $800.  (NOT $2,000 AS THE DEALER WOULD HAVE CHARGED.)   THIS SHOULD NOT BE A "CUSTOMER" PROBLEM.  THE PAINT PEELS OFF, GOES INTO SEWERS/GROUND AND POLLUTES.  THE RUST WEAKENS THE STRUCTURES OF THE VEHICLES AND MAKES THEM LESS SAFE.  FYI  I NOTICE LOADS OF VEHICLES IN THE SAME YEARS WITH THE "SAME" PROBLEMS.   THE JACK STAND BENT WHEN WE WERE CHANGING A TIME.  THE BOTTOM JUST BENT TO THE SIDE.  LUCKLY NO ONE WAS HURT AS THE TIRE WAS STILL ATTACHED WHEN IT BENT.

MONDAY WENT TO NEAREST SERVICE CENTER, FIRESTONE MASTERCARE, 1/2 MILE FROM HOTEL IN PALM HARBOR, FL. AFTER DIAGNOSTICS OF ABS FAILURE, FIRESTONE CONTACTED SEVERAL DEALERS FOR THE PARTS. NO DEALER WOULD RELEASE THE PARTS TO A 'RESELLER'. NEAREST PART COULD BE SHIPPED FROM ATLANTA. I AGREED TO OVERNIGHT SHIPPING. NEXT DAY, NO PART. CHRYSLER WOULD NOT SHIP TO A 'RESELLER'. ONLY AN AUTHORIZED DEALER CAN MAKE THE REPAIR. I WAS HEADED BACK HOME TO ATLANTA, SO I DROVE WITHOUT THE ABS AND ONLY MINIMUM BRAKING. ON 12/31/98 TOOK VAN TO DEALER. ON 1/4/99 DEALER ORDERED PARTS. BY 1/8 NO PARTS AVAILABLE. PARTS FINALLY AT DEALER ON 1/14 OR 15. VAN FIXED AND RETURNED. MY CONCERN IS THAT 1) THE PARTS FOR THE BRAKE RECALL #685 WERE NOT AVAILABLE TO A RESELLER, AND THEN NOT AVAILABLE FOR 2 WEEKS TO THE DEALER. THEN ACCORDING TO THE DEALER, MY SERVICE RECORD INDICATED THAT THIS RECALL WAS SERVICED ON 08/11/97 AND 12/17/97. I DO NOT REMEMBER A PROBLEM WITH THE BRAKES AT EITHER OF THOSE TIMES, NOR DO I REMEMBER HAVING THE BRAKES FIXED. HOWEVER, IF THE ABS WAS FIXED, IT HAS NOW FAILED FOR A 2ND TIME!!
